snippet: Despite President Obama’s call to help the middle class, unease lingered among those who said they were still earning less than before the recession.
abstract: Uneasiness affects people across country who say they are still earning less pay than before the recession and think Pres Obama overemphasized economic recovery in his State of the Union address; people anticipate few efforts to help middle class from divided government that appears partisan and frozen.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Jess Bidgood in Boston; Alan Blinder in Lithonia, Ga.; Ronnie Cohen in Marin County, Calif.; Mitch Smith in Chicago; and Julie Turkewitz in Denver.

lead_paragraph: Despite President Obama’s call to help the middle class, unease lingered among those who said they were still earning less than before the recession.

headline.main: Day After President’s Speech, Some Doubts Linger Over Nation’s Recovery
headline.print_headline: Day After President’s Speech, Some Doubts Linger Over Nation’s Recovery
